summary: This document is a series of emails from July 2020 between law enforcement personnel discussing and approving travel expenses for an operation to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation in Massachusetts. It reveals ongoing investigative activity related to the case years after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
persons.role: Law enforcement officer requesting travel approval
persons.context: The primary correspondent requesting approval for travel to Massachusetts to arrest a target in the Epstein investigation. They provide expense breakdowns and coordinate with supervisors.

persons.name: SSA Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
persons.role: FBI Supervisory Special Agent approving travel
persons.context: The approving official who authorizes the operational travel using a specific EAN (Event Authorization Number) for the arrest operation.

connections.person1: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
connections.person2: SSA Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS
connections.description: The detective requests travel approval from the SSA, who is the approving authority for the operational travel and funding.

events.title: Travel for arrest operation in Epstein investigation
events.description: Law enforcement personnel traveled to Massachusetts to arrest a target believed to be involved in the Epstein investigation, with plans to possibly escort the target back to New York.
personsInvolved: Detective NYPD / FBI Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force
SSA Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit FBIHQ/CID/VCS

keyFacts: The FBI and NYPD Child Exploitation Human Trafficking Task Force were actively pursuing arrests in the Epstein investigation as of June/July 2020.
A specific target, believed to be female ('her'), was located in Massachusetts and was the subject of a planned arrest operation.
The travel was approved under the FBI's Crimes Against Children and Human Trafficking Unit using operational funds (EAN 564339.1).
The operation involved four personnel: the detective, their partner, and two supervisors.
The document shows continued investigative activity related to the Epstein case nearly a year after Epstein's death in August 2019.
